Description: Round-topped limestone stela of Tapia; five concentric circles with a central rosette at the top; two lines of Greek text below. Description in Hall: Upper portion occupied by a design of five concentric circles with rosette in centre (development of the shell in temple-pediment type). One of the surrounding circles is beaded, another has two medallions on centre line of the tablet. Inscription in Greek below.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.136, Pl.98)
Tudor 2011 / Christian Funerary Stelae of the Byzantine and Arab Periods from Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.Brit.Mus.Gr. I 98:2 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
